name: Weather
description: Random weather conditions for travel, outdoor encounters, or setting the scene. Roll once per day or when conditions might change.

entries.result: Clear and sunny. Perfect traveling weather. No penalties.
Clear skies with a gentle breeze. Pleasant and mild.
Partly cloudy. Sun comes and goes throughout the day.
Overcast but dry. Gray skies, diffused light.
Warm and humid. Uncomfortable but manageable.
Cool and crisp. Excellent visibility, invigorating air.
Unusually warm for the season. Locals comment on it.
Unusually cold for the season. Frost where there shouldn't be.
Light wind picking up. Cloaks and loose items flutter.
Strong winds. Disadvantage on ranged attacks beyond 30 ft.
Gusty and unpredictable winds. Small items may blow away.
Light mist. Visibility reduced to 300 feet.
Morning fog burns off by midday. Early travel is slow.
Thick fog. Visibility reduced to 60 feet. Easy to get lost.
Light drizzle. Annoying but not dangerous.
Steady rain. Exposed flames extinguished. Mud forming.
Heavy rain. Disadvantage on Perception checks. Difficult terrain.
Torrential downpour. Travel speed halved. Rivers may flood.
Rain with distant thunder. Storm approaching or receding.
Thunderstorm. Seek shelter or risk lightning (1% chance per hour).
Severe thunderstorm. Lightning strikes nearby. Very dangerous.
Light snow or sleet. Ground becoming slippery.
Steady snowfall. Accumulating. Tracks easy to follow.
Heavy snow. Travel speed halved. Visibility 100 feet.
Blizzard conditions. Travel nearly impossible. Shelter required.
Freezing rain. Everything coated in ice. Extremely slippery.
Hail. Seek cover or take 1 bludgeoning damage per minute.
Extreme heat. CON save DC 10 every hour or gain exhaustion.
Extreme cold. CON save DC 10 every hour or gain exhaustion.
Sandstorm/Dust storm. Visibility 10 feet. Can't breathe without cover.
Still and oppressively quiet. Animals are silent. Eerie.
Beautiful rainbow after brief rain. Good omen?
Strange colored sky (red, green, purple). Unnatural feeling.
Ashfall from a distant volcano or massive fire.
Eclipse begins. Darkness at midday for 1d4 hours.
Meteor shower visible. Beautiful and potentially ominous.
Unnatural weather (raining frogs, blood-red rain, snow in summer).
Magical storm. Wild magic surges possible. Roll on Wild Magic if casting.
